title: ChatGPT Plus Free Access for Select Users Announced Until the End of May
story_summary: OpenAI announced that ChatGPT Plus will be free for select users until the end of May. The subscription, typically $20/month, grants access to deep research, reasoning models, and Sora video generation.  A separate promotion offers free access to US and Canadian students enrolled in degree-granting schools; they must verify status via SheerID. Current subscribers will receive two months of free access. ChatGPT Plus includes more file uploads, messages, image generation, and voice mode with video/screensharing. Subscribers can also create custom GPTs and test upcoming features.

title: CMF Phone 2 Rear Panel With Textured Design Teased by Nothing Ahead of Debut
story_summary: Nothing's sub-brand, CMF, teased the rear panel design of the upcoming CMF Phone 2, successor to the CMF Phone 1. The teaser reveals a matte finish on what appears to be the rear panel, held in place by screws. The phone features plastic edges and shows the CMF by Nothing logo. Leaks suggest a triple rear camera setup, an upgrade from the dual-camera setup of the Phone 1. The phone may also feature the Accessory Point system, supporting accessories like phone stands and lanyards.

title: Musk-Altman Fight Over OpenAI Overhaul Set for March Trial
story_summary: A federal judge has scheduled a trial for March in Elon Musk's lawsuit against Sam Altman and OpenAI, challenging OpenAI's restructuring. Musk claims the company abandoned its original non-profit mission after accepting billions from Microsoft. Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers previously denied Musk's request to halt OpenAI's transition to a for-profit model. OpenAI denies Musk's claims, alleging he aims to undermine a competitor. OpenAI recently finalized a $40 billion funding round led by SoftBank, valuing the company at $300 billion.

title: Oppo Reno 14 Pro Key Specifications, Design Render Showing Redesigned Camera Layout Leaked
story_summary: A design render of the Oppo Reno 14 Pro has leaked, revealing a redesigned camera layout. The phone is expected to feature a triple rear camera setup within a tweaked camera island, running on Android 15 with ColorOS 15. The device is anticipated to sport a flat OLED screen with a 120Hz refresh rate. It is rumored to have a 50MP primary camera with OIS, a 50MP periscope telephoto lens with 3.5x zoom, and an 8MP ultrawide lens. The Reno 14 Pro may include a programmable 'Magic Cube' button.

title: Meta Nears Release of New AI Model Llama 4 in April: Report
story_summary: Meta Platforms plans to release Llama 4, its latest large language model, this month, following earlier delays.  One reason for the delay was Llama 4 initially failing to meet Meta's benchmark expectations, especially in reasoning. Llama 4 is expected to incorporate technical aspects from DeepSeek, utilizing a 'mixture of experts' method. Meta is considering releasing it via Meta AI initially, followed by an open-source release. Meta plans to spend up to $65 billion expanding its AI infrastructure.

title: Massive Steam Plume Spotted at Alaska’s Mount Spurr as Volcano May Erupt Soon
story_summary: A large steam plume has been observed at Mount Spurr in Alaska, indicating increased volcanic activity. The Alaska Volcano Observatory (AVO) confirmed steam and gas emissions from the summit. Experts suggest a possible eruption in the coming weeks or months, but the timing remains uncertain. AVO noted a rise in gas emissions, suggesting fresh magma beneath the volcano.  Alert levels may increase with further signs of escalation like tremors, gas emissions, or surface changes. Hazards include ash clouds, ashfall, pyroclastic flows, and mudflows.

title: Study Identifies Plasma Formation as a Pseudostreamer
story_summary: A massive spiral of plasma, extending millions of kilometers from the Sun, has been identified as a pseudostreamer in a study.  Captured by the European Space Agency's Solar Orbiter, the event occurred after a coronal mass ejection. The plasma structure reached 1.5 times the Sun's width, visible for three hours. Scientists attribute twisting movement to Alfvénic fluctuations. The study also addressed streaks in the video, confirming them as distant stars due to the imaging process.

title: SpaceX Launches 27 Starlink Satellites on Falcon 9 Rocket, Booster Lands Safely
story_summary: SpaceX launched 27 Starlink satellites via a Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg Space Force Base. The first-stage booster successfully landed on a drone ship in the Pacific Ocean. This marked the fifth flight for this particular booster. The launch is part of SpaceX's ongoing efforts to expand its low Earth orbit Starlink network. This launch marks the 38th Falcon 9 launch of 2025, with most supporting Starlink. The Starlink constellation now has over 7100 satellites, aiming to provide global internet access.

title: Bats Avoid Mid-Air Crashes by Adjusting Their Echolocation During Flight
story_summary: A new study reveals how bats avoid collisions during mass flights by adjusting their echolocation. Researchers tracked greater mouse-tailed bats, finding that bats adjust calls became shorter, weaker, and at a higher frequency. 94% of bats had their echolocations jammed exiting caves.  Bats prioritize detecting the nearest barrier by changing echolocation to gather precise information about their immediate surroundings. Within five seconds, the jamming decreased and bats moved outward while staying in formation.

title: Anti-CBDC Bill Cleared by House Financial Services Committee in US: Details
story_summary: The US House Financial Services Committee cleared the Anti-CBDC Surveillance State Act, potentially blocking a US Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC). The bill, sponsored by Congressman Tom Emmer, aims to prevent financial surveillance of US citizens. Unlike cryptocurrencies, a CBDC is a digital version of fiat currency regulated by a central bank. The bill awaits a vote by the full House of Representatives. Republican lawmakers argue CBDCs could give the government unchecked access to Americans' transactions.
